title: Tinnitus Frequency Finder
description: Find the frequency that matches your tinnitus by adjusting the slider
instructionsText: Click PLAY and adjust the frequency slider until you find the tone that matches your tinnitus. Then select the waveform quality that most closely matches how your tinnitus sounds.
frequencyTooltip: Frequency is the pitch of sound measured in Hertz (Hz). Lower numbers = deeper sounds (like thunder), higher numbers = sharper sounds (like a whistle)
toneQualityTooltip: Different waveforms create different sound qualities. Sine = pure tone, Square = buzzy, Triangle = hollow, Sawtooth = harsh, Filtered = softer, Noise = static-like
settingsCopiedDesc: Your tinnitus settings have been copied to clipboard
aboutToolText1: This frequency finder helps you identify the specific pitch of your tinnitus. Most people experience tinnitus in the range of 3,000-8,000 Hz, but it can vary significantly.
aboutToolText2: Once you've identified your frequency, you can use this information with our other treatment tools like the Notched Noise Generator or discuss it with your healthcare provider.
